answerText: T cells[10] This protein is expressed on the surface of helper T cells, and serves as the receptor for HIV. As such, the count of cells with this protein on the surface is used to monitor AIDS treatment.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 11 | 14 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A subtype of these cells expressing the gamma-delta receptor are found in the gut mucosa. [10] Name this type of lymphocyte, whose helper variety is depleted in patients with AIDS. Their cytotoxic variety is responsible for killing cancerous or virally-infected host cells.
